actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that individuals who have attained age 59 1/2 may contribute to individual retirement accounts without regard to their compensation.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals who have attained age 59 and one-half to deduct amounts contributed to individual retirement accounts without regard to their compensation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that individuals who have attained age 59 1/2 may contribute to individual retirement accounts without regard to their compensation.
